text: research shows that loneliness is
actually worse for your health than
obesity smoking and high blood pressure
over 25% of people say they have nobody
to speak to about a personal problem
that means one in four people that you
meet doesn't have anyone that they feel
close enough to to share something with
research shows that lack of social
connection is linked to more anxiety
depression to suicide to anti-social
behavior and even health problems on the
flip side if you look at social
connections those people who are have
lives characterized by positive social
relationships other people they are
happier they live longer they recover
faster from disease and in general their
entire health and well-being is far
superior the good news though is that
these findings have nothing to do with
how many friends you have
if you subjectively on the inside feel
connected to other people then you
receive all of the benefits thereof so
how can you generate that sense of
social connection well one way to do
that is simply to take care of your
stress levels stress can make us feel
very isolated very self focused and it
can lower our ability to empathize with
other people the other way is to go out
and be of service to people it sounds
like a big lofty goal but it doesn't
have to be it could just be being kinder
to your colleagues and looking around
and seeing if there's anything you can
do for other people having that sense of
service and connection to others will
make you feel a greater sense of not
just connection but purpose and meaning
in your life
